name: Spectrobes: Brawl
description:
Spectrobes: Brawl

What is Spectrobes? Spectrobes was a monster collector that was a successful cult favourite but suddenly dropped and forgotten about over the years. I decided it was in dire need of a mini-game and ended up with Spectrobes: Brawl.

Control Spikan, the wrecking-ball-tailed monster, as you defend against ever-oncoming waves of Krawl, creatures of darkness. This 3D arcade-style beat-em-up aims to give you a quick session of good old-fashioned browser-based brawling as you try to beat your high-score.

This game was made in a month for personal fulfillment. If it is received well, it may be updated with more content in the future.

Downloadable PC version coming soon.

Features
  • 3D real-time brawling
    Based on the combat from the Nintendo-DS Spectrobes titles, this monster-battler lets you control Spikan in real-time and battle monsters based on timing, reflexes, and 3D movement. Dodge and demolish!
  • Many monsters
    Dozens of different Krawl with completely different attacks will come at you during the waves. Learn the attack styles of different species to out-maneuver them!
  • Simple controls
    Designed to be an easily-accessible browser game, the controls were kept very simple. With only 2 attacks, a dash, and a burst, you can focus on the action with a regular keyboard and mouse.
  • Rampage!
    Special attacks charge up to turn the tide of battle, and when that's not enough, Evolve Spikan into the invincible Spikanor to mow down enemies!
  • No hassle
    Play the entire game in-browser. No downloads needed or strings attached. No reason not to try it out ;)
  • Infinite play
     The game gradually gets more difficult as you reach stronger waves, but there are potentially infinite waves of monsters to fight. Keep trying to push your high-score higher and higher!
  • Nostalgia
    Whether you're a Spectrobes fan or just miss the old, infinite browser games of the past, this game was built to satisfy both.
Credits

Spectrobes is owned by Disney.

This fangame was made by Asith (@AsithDevs on Twitter, or join my Discord). Stick around for more Spectrobes or non-Spectrobes games. I have no idea what I could make next!
